reviews.text: The Casa Morisca is nice for a small, moderate hotel. It’s an easy walk to the shops and restaurants from there. There is a “Moorish” central courtyard; the rooms have lots of dark wood (we were on the second floor). There’s not too much noise from the side street. The room, while not large, is comfortable. The bathroom is a bit of a tight squeeze but does have its own window. There is no clock in the room, which seems typical of Spanish hotel rooms. This is obviously an old building but seems generally well maintained.
reviews.title: Comfortable Room In A Good Location

reviews.text: The hotel does not have a bar or restaurant although there is a breakfast room. There is a sitting room with some liquor bottles but I’m not sure what point they served as none of them appeared to be for guest’s use. There is free wi-fi, which is a nice touch. There is a sort of outside patio under an arbor but when we sat out there we found it dreary.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: We were in room 10; which is on the upper floor beside the elevator. I never heard the elevator doors opening and closing but you can just hear the soft hum of the elevator motor when it runs (it wasn’t a problem).
reviews.title: very nice ancient moorish house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was reasonably priced for a buffet breakfast. This is not a gourmet breakfast, however, there is cereal, fruit, coffee, cheese, meats, casserole, pastry, etc.
reviews.title: Great old house in Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are driving a car please read this carefully: the central part of downtown is an area of limited traffic. There is a street you are not allowed on without a permit (the hotel can provide this information). You must traverse the downtown zone in order to get to the hotel in a reasonable fashion. There is a section of street that has steel pillars that come out of the street that must be lowered for you to pass; if you pull up to these there is a button to push and you can tell the person who answers that you are staying at a hotel nearby and they should let you in. Be sure you advise your hotel ahead of time that you are coming in a car as they must notify the police of this. If you do not cross this zone the drive around is very long and very difficult.
reviews.title: Beautiful building & great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel end of July for three nights. It occupies an old 15th century building in the Albayzin area. It has 15 very nice room, some with views on the Alhambra. The hotel itself has a very nice, calm, atmosphere; the lovely internal patio has an ornamental pool/fountain, at night it is surrounded by candle lights which gives an extra touch of relaxation and cozyness. The position of the hotel is central, at a walking distance (15/20 min) from the centre. There is free, very limited parking just in front of the hotel, however it is a closed steep street, not very easy to find (our navigator had troubles in finding the way, though it is central).
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel witrh a great view

reviews.text: The personnel at the reception is very nice and welcoming, always available to give you information about the town and attractions. There is free wireless internet, though on the top floor the signal is not very strong, however in the basement there is a free computer with internet connection.
reviews.title: Great balance between luxury boutique hotel and quaint B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can have buffet breakfast for 10€, which is a quite good price for what they offer. This is a very nice little hotel, with an excellent relaxed ambiance. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful view of the Alhambra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my favorite hotel throughout our entire trip to Andalucia. It has a very homey quality with great architectural details. PROS: The room was very spacious and the high ceilings were great, we were on the top floor. The concierge was very helpful and even directed us to our favorite restaurant of the entire trip (awesome place close to the hotel called Azafran). There was a breakfast buffet in the basement area for 2 people for 10euros with good continental choices along with spanish omelette, juice, coffee, etc. Close enough to walk to the city center of Plaza Nueva and Gran Via. Great sitting area in the lobby to just relax and meet other guests of the hotel. CONS: Wifi's spotty if you're on one of the higher floors, more like non-existent actually. The hotel concierge receommended a flamenco show called Venta de Gallos and it really wasn't that great. I guess it was because I was comparing it with this amazing flamenco show in Sevilla at the Alvarez Quintaro theater and I felt so let down and totally disappointed. The climb to the entrance of the hotel is a bit steep and may be difficult for some people and watch out, the rocks are a bit slippery! Overall, still my favorite hotel, a great mix between a luxury boutique hotel and a bed & breakfast with an emphasis on service.
reviews.title: Elegant, clean, comfortable-wish we could have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to experience the atmosphere of the old quarters in Granada and still be near everything you could possibly want to see, this is the perfect location. This hotel is a beautifully restored Moorish house on the edge of the old section of Granada (Albayzin district); the hotel is on a narrow side street up a hill and faces a parking street that has no traffic. It’s very comfortable with the short walk into the main parts of town, as well as the proximity to the Alhambra and the Albayzin hill areas. You can come to the Alhambra Palace with the Cuesta de Gomerez way that starts from the bridge near the hotel.
reviews.title: Good location, Moorish design, free Internet

reviews.text: This was a fantastic place to stay. A beautiful internal courtyard. Clean rooms well appointed. Breakfast was great. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Parking available which is essential in Granada. Great position not far from most things. I would stay again with no hesitation.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Casa Morisca is a wonderful hotel. It is full of charm - like a reinvented Moorish house. The central courtyard is lovely. The room is a good size, full of character and immaculately clean. The staff spoke very good English and were very, very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located in the old Moorish section of Granada, so is surrounded by dozens of charming little alleys and narrow streets. There is free wi-fi in every room. The breakfast selection was small, but perfectly adequate. Unusually for me, there is nothing I could fault with this hotel - I cannot recommend it highly enough as the place to stay when you are in Granada.
reviews.title: Best 3 star hotel I have stayed in

reviews.text: Just back from a 3 night stay - wish it had been longer. We had a patio room ( internal view only) and before arriving I was a little concerned that we might be disappointed. Far from it. The room was quite small but very comfortable and well equipped and the view to the courtyard was lovely. The hotel is beautiful and very much like a Morrocan riad, cool and serene from the moment you step through the huge wooden door. The staff were friendly and gave great recommendations for places to eat and even booked bus tickets for us.
reviews.title: Perfect place in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a bus stop a few minutes away so it's easy to get to the Alhambra, the Plaza Nueva is a short stroll along a quiet road beside the river and there are plenty of restaurants within easy reach.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE!!!
My family loved our stay at this hotel.
reviews.text: We loved this place. Room was very nice & clean; very very friendly people at reception. Great location to go out for dinner at night. Really feel the Spain in this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to find , free parking and a great location with a side view of the Alhambra, from our first floor room With a sat nav downloaded from the internet finding the hotel was easy. Inside there is a delightful central space with a little Moorish fountain, The hotel has a lovely atmospshere. .Room was a bit small and basically furnished . Nice to have a kettle in teh room which we did not have in other Spainish hotels. Friendly staff . We ate breakfast in the cafes on Plaza Nueva to soak up the local colour. Its a short walk 7-8 miniute to this main square .
reviews.title: Moorish haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Casa Morisca for three nights in September and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The hotel is very charming and situated in a quiet spot in the old town. All the sights of Granada are within walking distance but there are tourist buses that stop close by if you prefer. We stayed in room eight, a superior double. The room was spacious and comfortable with a very nice bathroom. It would have benefitted from a decent hairdryer (the wall mounted contraption was completely ineffectual for someone with long hair).
reviews.title: Charming hotel in great location but give the breakfast a miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful, arranging restaurant reservations for us and booking into the Hamman spa.
reviews.title: Beautiful and a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast at the hotel one morning - unfortunately it was dreadful and a total waste of money at 8Euros. No fresh coffee - just a pot that had been warming for ages, cheese and ham that had been left out unrefridgerated and was greasy and unpleasant, stale bread and really quite horrible cereal. We ended up eating one of the small boxes of Kelloggs Fruit and Fibre that were left out - not quite what I had in mind!
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: Breakfast notwithstanding, I would still recommend this hotel for its peace, historic charm and excellent staff.
reviews.title: Like staying in a mini castle
